team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist.subsystems

Class DriveTrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • team2869.bethpage.robotics.aerialassist.subsystems.DriveTrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedSendable, Sendable

    public class DriveTrain
extends Subsystem
    This class extends Subsystem, and controls the drivetrain mechanism on the robot. It consists of four PowerControlJaguar instances for the four motors on the physical drivetrain. The RobotDrive class is utilized to implement the mecanum drive functionality easily. By default the orientation of the right wheels are set to be inverted, and the left wheels are not inverted. The subsystem frequently updates to the SmartDashboard.
    Author:
    BETHPAGE HIGH SCHOOL, 2014 TEAM #2869 - HARSHIL GARG

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DriveTrain()
      Constructs a new DriveTrain, with four PowerControlJaguars for each wheel that are grouped into a RobotDrive class.

    • Method Detail

      • initDefaultCommand

        public void initDefaultCommand()
        Initializes the default command that always runs on the DriveTrain, the MecanumDrive Command.
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class Subsystem

      • mecanumDrive

        public void mecanumDrive(double x,
                double y,
                double rotation,
                double gyroAngle)
        Implements the mecanumDrive function of the RobotDrive class to drive the robot.
        Parameters:
        x - The speed of the x directional movement.
        y - The speed of the y directional movement.
        rotation - The speed of the rotational movement.
        gyroAngle - Adjustment for field-centric driving. Should be zero for normal mecanum driving.

      • setOrientationRightWheels

        public void setOrientationRightWheels(boolean motorDirection)
        Sets the orientation of the right wheels, accounting for wiring issues.
        Parameters:
        motorDirection - If true, the motors will be inverted, and if false they will not be inverted.

      • setOrientationLeftWheels

        public void setOrientationLeftWheels(boolean motorDirection)
        Sets the orientation of the left wheels, accounting for wiring issues.
        Parameters:
        motorDirection - If true, the motors will be inverted, and if false they will not be inverted.

      • updateDashboard

        public void updateDashboard(double cartesianX,
                   double cartesianY,
                   double rotation)
        Updates the SmartDashboard with joystick values and motor speeds.
        Parameters:
        cartesianX - The primary joystick x value
        cartesianY - The primary joystick y value
        rotation - The secondary joystick x value
